5.2.4.3 Guidelines for MRI imaging in: Recommendations in patients with prior negative biopsy
When MRI is positive (i.e., PI-RADS > 3), perform targeted biopsy only.
When MRI is negative (i.e., PI-RADS < 2), and clinical suspicion of PCa is high, perform   systematic biopsy based on shared decision-making with the patient.
